docs.title: Specialization in Cybersecurity
docs.text: SRM Institute of Science and Technology (Kattankulathur Campus)

docs.title: Program Overview
docs.text:
• Degree: Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech)
  • Branch: Computer Science and Engineering
  • Specialization: Cybersecurity
  • Duration: 4 Years (8 Semesters)
  • Institution: SRMIST, KTR Campus
  • Mode: Full-Time

docs.title: Program Focus
docs.text:
This program is designed to build strong foundations in:

  • Core Computer Science
  • Secure System Design
  • Network & Application Security
  • Cryptography
  • Ethical Hacking & Digital Forensics

The curriculum balances theory, labs, and real-world security practices.

docs.title: Semester I – Foundations
docs.text:
Code Course Title L T P Credits 21LEH102T Foreign Language (Chinese/French/German/Japanese/Korean/Spanish) 2 1 0 3 21GNH101J Philosophy of Engineering 1 0 2 2 21MAB101T Calculus & Linear Algebra 3 1 0 4 21CYB101J Chemistry 3 1 2 5 21CSS101J Programming for Problem Solving 3 0 2 4 21MES101L Basic Civil & Mechanical Workshop 0 0 4 2 21PDM101L Professional Skills & Practices 0 0 2 0 21GNM101L Physical & Mental Health (Yoga) 0 0 2 0

Total Credits: 22

docs.title: Semester II – Core Engineering & Programming
docs.text:
Code Course Title L T P Credits 21LEH101T Communicative English 2 1 0 3 21MAB102T Advanced Calculus & Complex Analysis 3 1 0 4 21PHY102J Semiconductor Physics & Computational Methods 3 1 2 5 21MES102L Engineering Graphics & Design 0 0 4 2 21EES101T Electrical & Electronics Engineering 3 1 0 4 21CSS101T Object Oriented Design & Programming 3 1 0 4 21CVM101T Environmental Science 2 1 0 3 21PDM102L General Aptitude 0 0 2 0 21LEM101T Constitution of India 1 0 0 0

Total Credits: 21

docs.title: Cybersecurity-Oriented Learning (Later Semesters)
docs.text:
The program advances into specialized cybersecurity domains such as:

  • Cryptography & Network Security
  • Ethical Hacking & Penetration Testing
  • Secure Operating Systems
  • Malware Analysis
  • Web & Cloud Security
  • Digital Forensics
  • Cyber Laws & Ethics

docs.title: Practical Exposure
docs.text:
• Programming Labs (C / OOP / Python)
  • Network & Security Labs
  • Secure System Design Labs
  • Mini Projects
  • Final Year Capstone Project

docs.title: Career Opportunities
docs.text:
Graduates can pursue roles such as:

  • Cybersecurity Analyst
  • Security Engineer
  • Ethical Hacker / Penetration Tester
  • SOC Analyst
  • Digital Forensics Analyst
  • Cloud Security Engineer

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Curriculum structure is subject to SRMIST academic regulations.
  • Credit distribution and course codes may vary across academic years.

© SRM Institute of Science and Technology – KTR

BBA – Data Science
docs.text: Campus: Kattankulathur (KTR) Sanctioned Intake: 60 Annual Fees: INR 1,80,000 Duration: 3 Years Degree Offered: BBA (Honours)

docs.title: About the Program
docs.text:
BBA (Honours) is a three-year undergraduate program designed for students aspiring to build an intensive career in management. The program provides both academic rigor and industrial exposure, making students industry-ready.

The curriculum is structured to impart: - Industry-specific knowledge - Strong academic foundations - Practical exposure through internships

Students are encouraged to specialize in a focused domain, enabling them to manage, start, and grow new or existing businesses effectively.

docs.title: Specializations Offered
docs.text:
• Marketing
  • Finance
  • Human Resources
  • Operations Management

A one-month internship in the field of interest enhances domain expertise and employability.

  • Syllabus

docs.title: Eligibility for BBA – Data Science
docs.text:
• Pass in Higher Secondary Examination (+2)
  • Minimum 50% aggregate
  • Preference given to students without any break in study

Courses Offered:

docs.title: Welcome to EEE Program at SRMIST
docs.text: The B.Tech. (Electrical and Electronics Engineering) programme, established in 1992 under the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering at the Kattankulathur Campus, is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission (EAC) of ABET (https://www.abet.org). The programme also holds accreditation from the National Board of Accreditation (NBA), India, underscoring its commitment to quality and global academic standards.

docs.title: Program Quick Facts
docs.text: Attribute Details Campus Kattankulathur (KTR) Sanctioned Intake 240 students Annual Fees ₹2,75,000 Duration 4 Years (8 Semesters) Established 1992 Accreditations ABET (EAC), NBA India

docs.title: PEO 1: Technical Excellence
docs.text: Graduates are in a position to apply their knowledge acquired in Mathematics, Basic Sciences and Electrical and Electronics Engineering courses, to the solutions of complex problems encountered in the modern Engineering practice.

docs.title: PEO 2: Continuous Learning
docs.text: Graduates learn and adapt themselves to the constantly evolving technology by pursuing higher studies.

docs.title: PEO 3: Professional Success
docs.text: Graduates are better employable and achieve success in their chosen areas of Electrical and Electronics Engineering and related fields.

docs.title: PEO 4: Leadership & Communication
docs.text: Graduates are good leaders and managers by effectively communicating at both technical and interpersonal levels.

docs.title: Students Enrollment and Graduation Data
docs.text:
The program has consistently maintained excellent graduation rates:

Batch Actual Enrollment Graduated 2018-2022 316 315 2017-2021 280 272 2016-2020 450 426 2015-2019 446 408 2014-2018 432 389 2013-2017 475 467

docs.title: Career Avenues in the Modern Tech Landscape
🔧 Core Engineering Roles
docs.text: In power systems, smart grids, EVs, and energy management

docs.title: 🔬 Advanced Research & Innovation
docs.text: In areas like clean energy, AI-integrated systems, and Industry 4.0

docs.title: 🎓 Higher Studies in India & Abroad
docs.text: Masters/Ph.D. in interdisciplinary and emerging domains

docs.title: 💡 Tech Entrepreneurship
docs.text: Startups in electric mobility, automation, and IoT solutions

docs.title: 💻 Software-Defined Engineering
docs.text: Control, simulation, embedded systems, and digital twins

docs.title: 🌱 Sustainability and Consulting
docs.text: Green energy transition, ESG compliance, and techno-commercial roles

docs.title: Why Choose EEE at SRMIST?
docs.text:
• Global Accreditation: ABET and NBA accredited program
  • Experienced Faculty: Learn from industry experts and researchers
  • State-of-the-art Labs: Access to modern equipment and facilities
  • Industry Partnerships: Strong connections with leading companies
  • Research Opportunities: Engage in cutting-edge research projects
  • Excellent Placements: High placement rates with top companies
  • International Exposure: Exchange programs and collaborations

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Curriculum & Syllabus
  • Eligibility Criteria
  • Admission Process
  • Contact Information

docs.title: What You Have
docs.text: A fully functional documentation website for the B.Tech Electrical & Electronics Engineering program at SRMIST with: - ✅ All course information from the official SRMIST website - ✅ Professional Material Design theme - ✅ 5 comprehensive pages of content - ✅ Responsive design (mobile, tablet, desktop) - ✅ Dark/light mode toggle - ✅ Search functionality - ✅ Ready for deployment

docs.title: 📋 Files Overview
docs.text:
your-project/
├── docs/                      # Your content files
│   ├── index.md              # Home page
│   ├── eligibility.md        # Eligibility criteria
│   ├── admission.md          # Admission process
│   ├── curriculum.md         # Full curriculum (8 semesters)
│   ├── contact.md            # Contact & facilities
│   ├── stylesheets/
│   │   └── extra.css         # Custom styling
│   ├── javascripts/
│   │   └── extra.js          # Interactive features
│   └── assets/               # Images (add your logo here)
│
├── .github/
│   └── workflows/
│       └── deploy.yml        # Auto-deployment to GitHub Pages
│
├── mkdocs.yml                # Site configuration
├── requirements.txt          # Python dependencies
├── .gitignore               # Git ignore rules
├── README.md                 # Project documentation
├── QUICKSTART.md            # Quick start guide
└── PROJECT_SUMMARY.md       # What's included

docs.title: Option 1: View Locally (Testing) ⚡
docs.text:
Best for: Testing before deploying, making changes

Time: 2 minutes

Steps: 1. Open Terminal/Command Prompt 2. Navigate to this folder: bash cd path/to/your-project 3. Install dependencies: bash pip install -r requirements.txt 4. Start the server: bash mkdocs serve 5. Open browser: http://127.0.0.1:8000

Benefits: - See changes instantly - No internet needed - Perfect for development

docs.title: Option 2: Deploy to GitHub Pages (Recommended) 🌐
docs.text:
Best for: Sharing with others, permanent website

Time: 5 minutes

Cost: FREE

Result: Live website at https://yourusername.github.io/your-repo/

docs.title: Step-by-Step:
docs.text:
A. Create GitHub Account (if you don't have one) - Go to github.com - Sign up for free

B. Create New Repository 1. Click the "+" icon → "New repository" 2. Repository name: srm-eee-docs (or any name) 3. Description: "B.Tech EEE Program Documentation" 4. Choose: Public 5. Don't check any boxes (no README, .gitignore, or license) 6. Click "Create repository"

C. Upload Your Files

Option C1: Using Git (Command Line) ```bash # Navigate to your project folder cd path/to/your-project

# Initialize git git init git add . git commit -m "Initial commit: EEE documentation site"

# Add remote (replace YOUR-USERNAME and YOUR-REPO) git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/YOUR-REPO.git

# Push to GitHub git branch -M main git push -u origin main ```

Option C2: Using GitHub Website (Easier!) 1. In your new repository, click "uploading an existing file" 2. Drag and drop ALL your files 3. Scroll down and click "Commit changes"

D. Enable GitHub Pages 1. Go to your repository on GitHub 2. Click "Settings" (top menu) 3. Click "Pages" (left sidebar) 4. Under "Build and deployment": - Source: GitHub Actions 5. Wait 2-3 minutes

E. View Your Live Site! - Your site URL: https://YOUR-USERNAME.github.io/YOUR-REPO/ - Example: https://john123.github.io/srm-eee-docs/

Automatic Updates: - Every time you push changes to GitHub, the site automatically rebuilds! - No manual deployment needed

docs.title: Option 3: Export Static Files 📦
docs.text:
Best for: Uploading to your own hosting, USB drives, sharing offline

Steps:

cd path/to/your-project
pip install -r requirements.txt
mkdocs build

The site/ folder now contains your complete website: - Upload to any web hosting - Share the folder - Open site/index.html in any browser

docs.title: Change Site Name
docs.text:
Edit mkdocs.yml:

site_name: Your Custom Name Here
site_description: Your description

docs.title: Change Colors
docs.text:
Edit docs/stylesheets/extra.css:

:root {
  --srm-blue: #1565C0;    /* Main color */
  --srm-orange: #FF6F00;   /* Accent color */
}

docs.title: Add Your Logo
docs.text:
1. Save your logo as logo.png (PNG format, 200x200px recommended)
  2. Put it in docs/assets/ folder
  3. Logo will automatically appear in the header!

docs.title: Update Content
docs.text:
Simply edit the .md files in the docs/ folder: - Home page: docs/index.md - Eligibility: docs/eligibility.md - Admission: docs/admission.md - Curriculum: docs/curriculum.md - Contact: docs/contact.md

Markdown is easy! Examples:

# Big Heading
## Medium Heading
### Small Heading

**bold text**
*italic text*

- Bullet point 1
- Bullet point 2

[Link text](https://example.com)

![Image](path/to/image.png)

docs.title: Add New Page
docs.text:
1. Create new file: docs/your-page.md
  2. Add to mkdocs.yml under nav:: ```yaml nav:
    • Home: index.md
    • Your New Page: your-page.md
    • Eligibility: eligibility.md # ... rest of pages ```

docs.title: "pip: command not found"
docs.text: Install Python from python.org

docs.title: "mkdocs: command not found"
docs.text:
pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material
# or
pip3 install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Port 8000 in use
docs.text: mkdocs serve -a 127.0.0.1:8001

docs.title: GitHub Pages not working
docs.text:
• Wait 2-3 minutes after first push
  • Check Settings → Pages is configured correctly
  • Check Actions tab for deployment status
  • Make sure repository is Public

docs.title: Changes not showing on GitHub Pages
docs.text:
• Wait 1-2 minutes for rebuild
  • Hard refresh: Ctrl+Shift+R (Windows) or Cmd+Shift+R (Mac)
  • Clear browser cache

docs.title: Build errors
docs.text:
# Clean build
mkdocs build --clean

# Verbose mode to see errors
mkdocs build --verbose

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
• MkDocs Documentation
  • Material Theme Guide
  • Markdown Syntax

docs.title: Video Tutorials
docs.text:
• Search YouTube for "MkDocs tutorial"
  • "GitHub Pages tutorial"

docs.title: ✅ Quick Checklist
docs.text: Before deploying, make sure: - [ ] Tested locally with mkdocs serve - [ ] All content is correct - [ ] Links work properly - [ ] Images load correctly - [ ] Checked on mobile device - [ ] Updated site name in mkdocs.yml - [ ] Added your logo (optional)

docs.title: Locally Working When:
docs.text:
• ✅ mkdocs serve runs without errors
  • ✅ Browser shows site at localhost:8000
  • ✅ Navigation works
  • ✅ Search works

docs.title: GitHub Pages Working When:
docs.text:
• ✅ Repository has your files
  • ✅ Actions tab shows successful deployment
  • ✅ Settings → Pages shows your site URL
  • ✅ Visiting URL shows your site

docs.title: 💡 Pro Tips
docs.text:
1. Test Locally First: Always test changes with mkdocs serve before pushing to GitHub

  2. Regular Backups: Keep a copy of your files in multiple places

  3. Small Commits: Make small, frequent commits to GitHub rather than big ones

  4. Use Branches: For major changes, create a new branch: bash git checkout -b new-feature # make changes git commit -m "Added new feature" git push origin new-feature

  5. Document Changes: Write clear commit messages explaining what you changed

  6. Mobile Testing: Always check how it looks on mobile devices

  7. Performance: Keep images small (compress them before adding)

  8. Analytics: Add Google Analytics code to track visitors (optional)

docs.title: 🆘 Need More Help?
docs.text:
1. Read the README.md for detailed project info
  2. Check QUICKSTART.md for quick commands
  3. See PROJECT_SUMMARY.md for what's included
  4. Google specific errors (they're usually simple fixes!)
  5. Ask in GitHub Issues if you create a public repo

docs.title: 🚀 Next Steps
docs.text:
1. Right Now: Test locally bash pip install -r requirements.txt mkdocs serve

  2. In 5 Minutes: Deploy to GitHub Pages

  3. Create repo
  4. Upload files

  5. Enable Pages

  6. Later: Customize

  7. Change colors
  8. Add logo

  9. Update content

  10. Share: Send your URL to others!

You're all set! Everything is ready to go. Just follow one of the three options above and you'll have a live website in minutes! 🎊

Good luck! 🌟

docs.title: Project Summary: B.Tech EEE Documentation Website
What Has Been Created
docs.text: I've built a complete, professional documentation website for the B.Tech Electrical & Electronics Engineering program at SRMIST. This is a ready-to-deploy website with all the information from the official SRMIST page.

docs.title: Core Documentation Files
docs.text:
1. index.md - Home page with program overview, PEOs, enrollment data, and career paths
  2. eligibility.md - Complete eligibility criteria with age, qualification, and admission requirements
  3. admission.md - Step-by-step admission process with fee structure and contact info
  4. curriculum.md - Full 8-semester curriculum with all courses, credits, and structure
  5. contact.md - Contact information, campus facilities, and location details

docs.title: Configuration Files
docs.text:
1. mkdocs.yml - Site configuration with navigation, theme settings, and features
  2. requirements.txt - Python dependencies (MkDocs, Material theme)
  3. README.md - Complete project documentation and setup instructions
  4. QUICKSTART.md - Simple guide to get started quickly
  5. .gitignore - Git ignore rules for clean repository

docs.title: Styling & Scripts
docs.text:
1. docs/stylesheets/extra.css - Custom CSS for SRMIST branding
  2. docs/javascripts/extra.js - Interactive features and animations

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text: 1. .github/workflows/deploy.yml - Automatic GitHub Pages deployment

docs.text:
• ✅ Complete program information from SRMIST website

docs.title: 1. GitHub Pages (Recommended)
docs.text:
• Setup Time: 5 minutes
  • Cost: Free
  • URL: https://username.github.io/repo-name/
  • Auto-Deploy: Yes (on every push)
  • Steps: Upload to GitHub, enable Pages

docs.text:
• Setup Time: 2 minutes
  • Command: mkdocs serve
  • URL: http://127.0.0.1:8000
  • Use Case: Testing before deployment

docs.title: 3. Other Hosting
docs.text: The site/ folder after running mkdocs build can be uploaded to: - Netlify - Vercel - AWS S3 - Any web hosting service

docs.title: For Immediate Use:
docs.text:
1. Extract all files
  2. Install Python and pip
  3. Run: pip install -r requirements.txt
  4. Run: mkdocs serve
  5. Visit: http://127.0.0.1:8000

docs.text:
1. Create GitHub repository
  2. Upload all files
  3. Enable GitHub Pages in settings
  4. Site deploys automatically!

• Colors: Edit docs/stylesheets/extra.css

  10. Future-Proof: Uses modern web standards

  4. GitHub Pages: Just push to GitHub

docs.title: How to Apply for B.Tech EEE Program
docs.text: The admission process at SRMIST is designed to be simple and student-friendly. Follow these three steps to secure your seat in the B.Tech Electrical & Electronics Engineering program.

docs.title: Create Your Account
docs.text:
Sign up or Register for SRMJEEE (UG) with basic details:

  • Name
  • Email ID (will be your username)
  • Mobile Number
  • State
  • Gender
  • Password (set by you)

docs.title: Confirmation
docs.text:
On successful registration, you will receive a confirmation message on your: - Registered contact number - Email ID

Use your Email ID (Username) and Password to log in to your SRMJEEE account.

Register Now{ .md-button .md-button--primary }

docs.title: Take SRMJEEE (UG)
docs.text:
After registration, you'll need to:

  1. Complete the application form with all required details
  2. Upload necessary documents:
  3. Recent photograph
  4. Signature
  5. 10th & 12th mark sheets

  6. Other relevant certificates

  7. Pay the application fee

  8. Attempt the entrance exam covering:
  9. Physics
  10. Chemistry
  11. Mathematics
  12. English
  13. Aptitude

docs.title: Exam Pattern
docs.text: Subject Questions Duration Physics 35 questions 2.5 hours Chemistry 35 questions (Total) Mathematics 35 questions English & Aptitude 20 questions

docs.title: Based on Entrance Results
docs.text:
After the SRMJEEE (UG) results are announced:

  1. Check your results using your login credentials
  2. Attend counseling (if shortlisted)
  3. Select your preferred program (B.Tech EEE)
  4. Pay the admission fee to confirm your seat
  5. Submit original documents for verification

docs.title: Document Verification
docs.text:
Bring the following original documents for verification:

  • 10th Standard Mark Sheet & Certificate
  • 12th Standard Mark Sheet & Certificate
  • Transfer Certificate (TC)
  • Community Certificate (if applicable)
  • Income Certificate (for scholarship claims)
  • SRMJEEE Rank Card
  • Identity Proof (Aadhar Card/Passport)
  • Photographs (passport size)

docs.title: Direct Admission
docs.text: SRMIST offers direct admission and scholarships to students with exceptional talent:

docs.title: Eligible for Direct Admission:
docs.text:
• First rank holders from all central and state boards in India
  • Top 10,000 rankers in IIT JEE
  • Top rankers in each district of Tamil Nadu
  • Exemplary sports persons at National and International levels

docs.title: International Students
docs.text:
NRIs and international students who have not taken SRMJEEE (UG) should:

  1. Apply through the International Student Category
  2. Visit: International Admissions
  3. Follow the specific guidelines for international applicants

docs.title: Important Dates (2026 Intake)
docs.text:
!!! info "Stay Updated" Please check the official SRMIST website regularly for: - Application opening date - Last date for registration - Exam dates - Results announcement - Counseling schedule

Visit Official Admissions Page{ .md-button }

docs.title: Fee Structure
docs.text:
Component Amount (INR) Annual Tuition Fee ₹2,75,000 Hostel Fee (Optional) Contact admissions Other Fees As per university norms

!!! note "Fee Payment" - Fees can be paid online or through demand draft - Installment options may be available - Scholarships can reduce the fee burden

docs.title: Scholarship Opportunities
docs.text:
SRMIST offers various scholarships based on:

  • Merit: Academic excellence in 12th standard
  • SRMJEEE Performance: Top rankers receive scholarships
  • Sports Achievements: National/International level players
  • Economic Background: Need-based financial assistance

For detailed scholarship information, visit the Scholarships Page.

Placement Statistics: - High placement percentage - Competitive salary packages - Recruiters from diverse sectors

Stay connected with SRMIST:

  • Facebook: SRMUniversityOfficial

docs.title: B.Tech Electrical & Electronics Engineering - Course Structure
docs.text: The 4-year B.Tech EEE program is divided into 8 semesters with a comprehensive curriculum covering fundamental sciences, core electrical engineering subjects, and specialized electives.

docs.title: Semester I
docs.text:
Code Course Title L T P Credits Language Courses (Choose One) 18LEH10XJ Chinese 2 0 2 3 18LEH10XJ French 2 0 2 3 18LEH10XJ German 2 0 2 3 18LEH10XJ Japanese 2 0 2 3 18LEH10XJ Korean 2 0 2 3 Core Courses 18MAB101T Calculus and Linear Algebra 3 1 0 4 18CYB101J Chemistry 3 1 2 5 18CSS101J Programming for Problem Solving 3 0 4 5 18MES103L Civil and Mechanical Engineering Workshop 1 0 4 3 18PDM101L Professional Skills and Practices 0 0 2 0 18LEM102J Value Education 1 0 1 0 Extra-Curricular (Choose One) 18GNM102L NSS (National Service Scheme) 0 0 2 0 18GNM103L NCC (National Cadet Corps) 0 0 2 0 18GNM104L NSO (National Sports Organization) 0 0 2 0

L = Lecture hours, T = Tutorial hours, P = Practical hours

docs.title: Semester II
docs.text: Code Course Title L T P Credits 18LEH101J English 2 0 2 3 18MAB102T Advanced Calculus and Complex Analysis 3 1 0 4 18PYB101J Physics: Electromagnetic Theory, Quantum Mechanics, Waves and Optics 3 1 2 5 18MES101L Engineering Graphics and Design 1 0 4 3 18EES101J Basic Electrical and Electronics Engineering 3 1 2 5 18PDH101T General Aptitude 0 0 2 1 18LEM101T Constitution of India 1 0 0 0 18GNM101L Physical and Mental Health using Yoga 0 0 2 0

docs.title: Semester III
docs.text: Code Course Title L T P Credits 18MAB201T Transforms and Boundary Value Problems 3 1 0 4 18EEC201J Analysis of Electric Circuits 3 0 2 4 18EEC202T Electromagnetic Theory 3 1 0 4 18EEC203J Digital System Design 3 0 2 4 18EEC204J Electrical Machines I 3 0 2 4 18PDH103T Social Engineering 2 0 0 2 18PDM201L Competencies in Social Skills 0 0 2 0 18PDM203L Entrepreneurial Skill Development 0 0 2 0 18CYM101T Environmental Science 1 0 0 0

docs.title: Semester IV
docs.text: Code Course Title L T P Credits 18MAB202T Numerical Methods for Engineers 3 1 0 4 18BTB101T Biology 2 0 0 2 18EEC205J Electrical Machines II 3 0 2 4 18EEC206J Analog Electronics 3 0 2 4 18EEC207J Electrical and Electronics Measurements and Instrumentation 3 0 2 4 18EEC208T Generation, Transmission & Distribution 3 0 0 3 18PDH102T Management Principles for Engineers 2 0 0 2 18PDM202L Critical and Creative Thinking Skills 0 0 2 0 18PDM204L Business Basics for Entrepreneurs 0 0 2 0

docs.title: Semester V
docs.text: Code Course Title L T P Credits 18MAB301T Probability and Statistics 3 1 0 4 18EEC301J Control Systems 3 0 2 4 18EEC302J Power Electronics 3 0 2 4 18EEC303T Power System Analysis 3 0 0 3 — Professional Elective – 1 3 0 0 3 — Professional Elective – 2 3 0 0 3 — Open Elective – 1 3 0 0 3 18EEP101L MOOC-1 0 0 2 1 18EEP102L Industrial Training-I 0 0 2 1 18EEP103L Seminar - I 0 0 2 1 18PDM301L Analytical and Logical Thinking Skills 0 0 2 0 19PDM302L Entrepreneurship Management 0 0 2 0 18LEM109T Indian Traditional Knowledge 1 0 0 0

docs.title: Semester VI
docs.text: Code Course Title L T P Credits 18MAB302T Discrete Mathematics for Engineers 3 1 0 4 18EEC304J Microcontrollers 3 0 2 4 18EEC305T Power System Protection 3 0 0 3 18EEC350T Comprehension 0 1 0 1 — Professional Elective – 3 3 0 0 3 — Professional Elective – 4 3 0 0 3 — Open Elective – 2 3 0 0 3 18EEP104L MOOC-2 0 0 2 1 18EEP105L Industrial Training-2 0 0 2 1 18EEP106L Seminar - 2 0 0 2 1 18PDH201T Employability Skills and Practices 0 0 2 1 18LEM110L Indian Art Form 0 0 2 0

docs.title: Semester VII
docs.text: Code Course Title L T P Credits 18EEC401J Power System Operation and Control 3 0 2 4 — Professional Elective – 5 3 0 0 3 — Professional Elective – 6 3 0 0 3 — Open Elective – 3 3 0 0 3 18EEP107L Minor Project 0 0 6 3 18EEP108L Internship (4-6 weeks) 0 0 6 3

docs.title: Semester VIII
docs.text: Code Course Title L T P Credits Choose One: 18EEP109L Major Project 0 0 10 5 18EEP110L Semester Internship 0 0 10 5

docs.title: Core Electrical Engineering Subjects
docs.text:
Year 1 & 2 Foundation: - Circuit Analysis - Electromagnetic Theory - Digital System Design - Electrical Machines (I & II) - Analog Electronics - Measurements & Instrumentation

Year 3 & 4 Advanced: - Control Systems - Power Electronics - Power System Analysis - Power System Protection - Microcontrollers - Power System Operation and Control

docs.title: Mathematical Foundation
docs.text:
• Calculus and Linear Algebra
  • Advanced Calculus and Complex Analysis
  • Transforms and Boundary Value Problems
  • Numerical Methods
  • Probability and Statistics
  • Discrete Mathematics

docs.title: Practical Training
docs.text:
• Industrial Training: Two phases in Semesters V & VI
  • Seminars: Present technical topics
  • MOOC Courses: Online learning from global platforms
  • Minor Project: Semester VII
  • Major Project/Internship: Semester VIII

docs.title: Professional Development
docs.text:
• Programming for Problem Solving
  • Management Principles for Engineers
  • Entrepreneurship Management
  • Employability Skills and Practices
  • Critical and Creative Thinking Skills

docs.title: Electives
docs.text:
Students have the flexibility to choose from various Professional Electives and Open Electives to specialize in areas of interest such as:

  • Renewable Energy Systems
  • Electric Vehicles
  • Smart Grids
  • Automation and Robotics
  • VLSI Design
  • Communication Systems
  • AI and Machine Learning applications

!!! info "Elective Selection" Detailed list of electives will be provided at the beginning of each semester. Students can choose based on their career interests and industry trends.

docs.title: MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses)
docs.text: Students are required to complete approved online courses from platforms like: - NPTEL - Coursera - edX - Swayam

docs.title: Value-Added Programs
docs.text:
• Indian Traditional Knowledge
  • Indian Art Form
  • Constitution of India
  • Value Education

docs.title: Extracurricular Activities
docs.text:
• NSS (National Service Scheme)
  • NCC (National Cadet Corps)
  • NSO (National Sports Organization)
  • Yoga and Physical Fitness

docs.title: Assessment Pattern
docs.text:
Evaluation is based on: - Continuous Internal Assessment: 40% - End Semester Examination: 60% - Practical/Lab Work: Based on performance and viva - Project Work: Continuous evaluation and final presentation

For detailed syllabus of each course, please visit: Engineering & Technology Curriculum

Back to Home{ .md-button }

docs.title: Eee
docs.text: somethig

docs.title: (a) Nationality and Age
docs.text:
Eligible Candidates: - Resident Indian - Non-Resident Indian (NRI) - Holder of PIO (Person of Indian Origin) card issued by Government of India - Holder of OCI (Overseas Citizen of India) card issued by Government of India

!!! note "Important Note for NRIs" NRIs, holders of PIO or OCI card issued by Government of India who have not taken the SRMJEEE (UG) must apply under International student category only.

Age Requirement: Should have attained the age of 16 years and 6 months on the 31st July of the calendar year in which the 12th Board examination is to be held.

docs.title: All B.Tech Programmes
docs.text: Minimum Requirement: 60% aggregate in Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics (PCM)

docs.title: Option 1: Indian Board Examination
docs.text:
Passed in Higher secondary examination (10+2 pattern) or appearing in Higher Secondary examination in the current academic year with:

Compulsory Subjects: - Physics - Mathematics

One of the following major subjects: - Chemistry - Biotechnology - Biology - Technical Vocational subject - Computer Science - Information Technology - Informatics Practices - Agriculture - Engineering Graphics - Business Studies

Accepted Boards: - Any State Board within India - CBSE (Central Board of Secondary Education) - ICSE (Indian Certificate of Secondary Education) - Matriculation - NIOS (National Institute of Open Schooling)

!!! warning "NIOS Students Note" Students who have completed +2 under NIOS must have completed the 10th standard from regular schooling or vice-versa.

docs.title: Option 2: International Examination
docs.text:
• GCE A-level, OR
  • International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma, OR
  • IB Certificate

With Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the major subjects listed above (equivalent to Advanced Placement level in each subject) in any International schools within India.

docs.title: (c) SRMJEEE (UG) Entrance Examination
docs.text:
Candidates who have attempted the following sections in SRMJEEE (UG) are eligible for all B.Tech Degree Programs:

  • Physics
  • Chemistry
  • Mathematics
  • English
  • Aptitude

docs.title: (d) Direct Admission
docs.text:
To encourage and support students of exemplary talent, SRM Institute of Science and Technology offers direct admission and scholarships to:

  • First rank students of all the central and state boards in India
  • Top 10,000 rankers in IIT JEE
  • Top rankers in each district of Tamil Nadu
  • Exemplary sports persons at National and International level

docs.title: Summary Checklist
docs.text:
Before applying, ensure you meet the following criteria:

  • [ ] Age requirement: 16.5 years by July 31st
  • [ ] Minimum 60% in PCM subjects
  • [ ] Physics and Mathematics are mandatory
  • [ ] One additional subject from the approved list
  • [ ] Valid board certification (or appearing in current year)
  • [ ] For NIOS: Alternating regular schooling for 10th or 12th

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
If you have questions about eligibility, please:
